front.title: An Overview of Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) Mechanisms

abstract.t: Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) is a general termthat refers to a toolset that can be used for fault detection andlocalization, and for performance measurement. OAM mechanisms havebeen defined for various layers in the protocol stack, and are usedwith a variety of protocols.This document presents an overview of the OAM mechanisms that havebeen defined and are currently being defined by the IETF, as well asa comparison to other OAM mechanisms that have been defined by theIEEE and ITU-T.
